availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, businessman. Secretary and superintendent of the Louisville City Railroad. Superintendent of the Louisville streetcar line some time prior to 1866. Notary public in Jefferson County, Kentucky in 1864.

bibl.p: Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions . . . in the City of Louisville for 1865-6 (St. Louis: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1865), p. 283; “Death of Captain A O Durland,” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), August 8, 1902, p. 2.
